content:
Aylen stood in the park, her heart pounding as she searched for the figure. She could feel its presence, could sense it watching her. Suddenly, it appeared, taking on the form of a person she had once trusted. "You can't run from me, Aylen," it taunted, its voice low and menacing.

Aylen clenched her fists, determined to face this thing head-on. "What do you want from me?" she shouted.

The figure grinned, its eyes glinting with malice. "Want? I don't want anything from you, Aylen. I just enjoy watching you suffer."

Aylen lunged at it, but her hands passed through its form as if it were made of smoke. The figure laughed, darting away and reappearing a few feet away. "You can't touch me, Aylen. I am beyond your reach."

Aylen turned in circles, trying to keep the figure in her sight. "Why are you doing this to me?" she cried.

The figure shrugged, its form shifting to that of another person Aylen had known. "Why not? You're weak, Aylen. Easy to manipulate and control. It's so entertaining."

Aylen felt tears of frustration prick at her eyes. "Please, just leave me alone," she begged.

The figure's grin widened. "Never, Aylen. I'll be with you always. Watching, waiting, enjoying your pain." And with that, it vanished, leaving Aylen alone in the park, trembling with fear and anger.
